attributes.action: Action against Joseph Kony and the LRA.
attributes.additional_details:
I would like the government to discuss their stance and what action they think would be appropriate against the international Criminal Courts number one most wanted man, the leader of a rebel militia from Uganda, the Lord's Resistance Army - Joseph Kony. This man is responsible for the kidnapping of 30,000 African children, their torture and conversion into child soldiers and sex slaves.

The Ugandan government is happy for outside powers to intervene in the matter. As one of the most advanced nations in the world with the technology and committed professionals to hunt down and bring this man to justice I would like to know why we aren't doing just that.
